original_title: Sri Lanka to negotiate with Paris Club and China separately: President
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka will discuss debt restructuring with the Paris Club including India and China separately, as part of an International Monetary Fund backed plan to reduce and manage debt, President Ranil Wickremsinghe said.
India and Paris Club and given assurances to restructure debt and China had also given assurances allowing the International Monetary Fund program to be approved.
“China is expecting to work separately,” President Wickremesignhe told parliament, kicking off a debate on the IMF deal.
“Then on one side we are discussing with Paris Club and India on one side. On the other side will talk with China.”
The IMF deal expected to 17 billion dollar reduction in foreign debt, he said.
Sri Lanka was also expecting to talk with private creditors.
Related Sri Lanka to negotiate with Paris Club and China separately: President
Domestic debt also has to be re-structured, he said. But not final decision has been reached. (Colombo/Apr26/2023)
